verses.text: 我是沙崙平原的水仙花，是谷中的百合花。

words.note: Often interpreted as 'rose of Sharon' or 'narcissus' in context.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'in the middle of' or 'among'.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved to Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H0589"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 我的佳偶在女子中，正像荊棘裡的百合花。

words.note: A poetic term for a beloved partner, especially in classical texts.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'in the middle of' or 'among'.
Common imagery in biblical texts.
Used as a postposition to indicate location 'inside'.

verses.heading: \qt \+w The Lover to His Beloved:|strong="H7799"\+w*\qt*

verses.text: 我的良人在男子中，好像樹林裡的一棵蘋果樹；我歡歡喜喜地坐在它的蔭下，它的果子香甜合我口味。

words.note: A poetic term for a beloved husband or partner, especially in classical texts.
Used as a postposition to indicate 'in the middle of' or 'among'.
Used as a postposition to indicate location 'inside'.
Reduplicated adjective (AA-BB) forming an adverb, emphasizing joy.

verses.heading: \qt \+w The Beloved about Her Lover:|strong="H8598"\+w*\qt*

verses.text: 他帶我進入酒室，含情脈脈地望著我。

words.note: A four-character idiom (chéngyǔ) describing deep affection or tender glances.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved about Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H0935"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 求你們用葡萄餅增補我力，用蘋果恢復我的精神，因為我因愛成病。

words.note: Often refers to cakes of dried grapes/raisins in biblical contexts.
Literally 'increase and supplement'.
A verb-object compound, often used in literary or poetic contexts.

verses.text: 他的左手托住我的頭，他的右手擁抱著我。
耶路撒冷的眾女子啊！我指著田野的羚羊、母鹿懇求你們，不要激動，不要挑動愛情，等它自發吧。

words.note: Often used in the context of swearing an oath by something.

verses.heading: \qt \+w The|strong="H0853"\+w* \+w Beloved|strong="H5782"\+w* \+w to the Maidens|strong="H5782"\+w*\+w :|strong="H5782"\+w*\qt*

verses.text: 聽啊！這是我良人的聲音，他躥山越嶺而來。

words.note: A poetic or classical term for one's beloved spouse.
An idiom describing vigorous and swift travel over difficult terrain.
Classical conjunction indicating consequence or connection.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved about Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H6963"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 我的良人像羚羊，像小鹿。看哪！他站在我們的牆後；從窗口觀看，從窗格往裡面探視。

words.note: Used to draw attention, common in biblical texts.
Refers to the latticework or frame of an ancient window.

verses.text: 我的良人對我說：「我的佳偶啊！你起來吧。我的佳麗啊！你來吧。

words.note: A poetic term for a beloved female partner or spouse.
A poetic term emphasizing beauty, often referring to a beloved woman.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Lover\+it*\+qt*|strong="H6030"\+w* \+w to His Beloved:|strong="H1730"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 因為冬天已過，雨水止息，已經過去了。

words.note: More formal than '停止'.
Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 地上百花齊放，百鳥齊鳴的時候已經來到；斑鳩的聲音在我們境內也聽見了。

words.definition: on the earth, on the ground

words.note: Literary, 'a hundred flowers'.
Often used in poetic or descriptive contexts.
Literary, 'a hundred birds'.
Often used in poetic or descriptive contexts.
A type of dove, often mentioned in biblical texts.

words.definition: within the border, in the territory

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.

verses.text: 無花果樹的果子漸漸成熟，葡萄樹開花發香，我的佳偶啊！你起來吧。我的佳麗啊！你來吧。

words.note: Lit. 'no-flower-fruit-tree' as fig blossoms are inconspicuous.
Common in biblical imagery.
Literary term for a beloved spouse.
Expresses exclamation or surprise.
Softens a command or suggestion.
Literary term for a beautiful woman.
Expresses exclamation or surprise.
Softens a command or suggestion.

verses.text: 我的鴿子啊！在巖石的穴中，在懸崖石的隱密處，讓我看看你的容貌；讓我聽聽你的聲音；因為你的聲音甜美，你的容貌秀麗。

words.note: Often symbolic in biblical texts.
Expresses exclamation or surprise.
Often used in biblical descriptions of nature.
Specific type of rock formation.
Common phrase in religious texts referring to a secluded spot.
Reduplicated verb for milder tone or brief action.
More formal than just 'face'.
Reduplicated verb for milder tone or brief action.
More formal than just 'face'.
Often used to describe scenery or a refined beauty.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Lover to His Beloved:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H3123"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 要為我們捉拿狐狸，就是毀壞葡萄園的小狐狸，因為我們的葡萄園正在開花。」

words.note: Common imagery in the Bible representing a cultivated area.
Emphasizes the small size or cunning nature.
Common imagery in the Bible representing a cultivated area.
Indicates continuous action.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved to Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H0270"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 我的良人屬我，我也屬他，他在百合花中細賞。

words.note: A term of endearment for one's husband or lover in classical Chinese and scripture.
Often used as a suffix following a noun to denote 'in the midst of'.
Implies a detailed and appreciative observation.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved about Her Lover\+it*\+qt*:|strong="H1730"\+w*\bd*

verses.text: 我的良人啊！等到天起涼風，日影消逝的時候，願你歸來，好像崎嶇山上的羚羊或是小鹿。

words.note: A term of endearment for one's husband or lover in classical Chinese and scripture.
Indicates surprise, admiration, or a plea.
Refers to lengthening shadows as the sun sets, symbolizing end of day.
Forms a nominalizer with the preceding phrase.
Describes uneven, difficult terrain.

verses.heading: \bd \+w \+qt \+it The Beloved to Her Lover:\+it*\+qt*|strong="H5704"\+w*\bd*
